website_summaries.verdict: Many homeowners only need a short transitional ramp for a few outdoor steps or higher room threshold. This is definitely one to consider for either long-term or short-term use.
pros: Higher price point, but very durable construction
Can be installed for permanent use
Accommodates different wheel types and widths
cons: Lip edges are very sharp, challenging to transport safely
Heavier than expected, not ideal for independent use

customer_reviews.title: Get The Right Size/ It Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Great little ramp. We only need ours when my moms in her wheel chair to get out the front door. So this fold up ramp is great for that. I ordered the 3Ft first, but realized it was too short so had to get the 4Ft. I should note here that I had to pay return shipping though. I was a little disappointed with that, but it was my own mistake ordering the wrong size. It’s sturdy, the sandpaper like grip on top is great, and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McKinney

customer_reviews.title: This "suitcase" ramp is strong and stable. I pinned ...
customer_reviews.text: This "suitcase" ramp is strong and stable. I pinned the ramp to the step using 1/4" x 1" steel pins with a finger ring at one end (Home Depot standard item). The ramp does not move, yet can be removed by pulling 2 pins. EZ should consider including these with each ramp for safety. I also added 1/8" strips to 1/2 fill the gap between the end of the ramp and the peak of the threshold.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: A Good Decent Ramp
customer_reviews.text: This is a good solid ramp. However, the lips are razor sharp and as this is made to be transportable, not a good idea when people are moving it about. Also, the space in the middle where the ramp can detach, it's wider than expected when the bolts are in. My stepfather's 4-wheel electric wheelchair had no problem, but my mother's 3-wheel power scooter had issues maneuvering it. This is probably best for wheelchairs and scooters with four wheels and not three.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Compact - easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My elderly mother had hip replacement surgery and was wheelchair bound for a bit of time. We are in a rented house so we couldn't do any sort of permanent ramp so this was our next option. We ordered 2 as our front door area was longer than a single ramp could handle. They are 'light' in contrast with what you'd think they'd be - and sturdy! The wheelchair goes up and down with ease. The design folds in half so they can load them into the van and take with as needed so they've ALWAYS got access.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works But
customer_reviews.text: No complaints about the quality and sturdiness of the ramp. We wanted to use it for an entry door where there is limited space for the ramp. Went ahead and got one to fit our space but I didn't spend enough time evaluating the rise we needed to navigate. Our ramp length left us with a slope of the ramp that is a little steeper than I'd like when moving our wheelchair patient up and down. It's workable but am wiser now. Get the longest ramp you have room for. Makes for a gentler slope and easier use.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Buy it longer than you estimate you need
customer_reviews.text: I find it works better upside down, not the way the instructions indicate. It's stable & light weight. Despite doing the measurements, i'd buy a foot longer in the future. For my short 3 step, I would buy a 6' length but this may be a generic issue not associated with the ramp. The 5' is steeper than I'd like the ramp to be.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind and safety!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, had a hard time finding a company that would deliver a well rated ramp to my dad/brother in Hawaii AND for a reasonable price. Thanks!!!

customer_reviews.title: Helpful

But, the ramp works and is light enough to move for the 3 sets of steps we have to get out of the house. The ramp does scratch the floor and concrete if/when you move it (even if you are super careful). The ramp is probably best kept in once place.

customer_reviews.title: I used to load riding mower into shed....

Might have to snip some off to close doors on shed, or just take ramps on & off when I want to load mower. Had no problem riding mower into shed without putting screw in lip. I'll see, no decision yet.

product_meta.title: EZ-ACCESS SUITCASE Singlefold AS Portable Ramp, 6'
product_meta.description: Size:6 Foot| Style:Applied SurfaceThe SUITCASE Singlefold AS Ramp offers a simple and convenient way for wheelchairs, scooters, and power chairs to access vehicles and overcome steps and curbs with ease. The Singlefold AS is a versatile ramp that can be separated into two sections, making it even easier to use, carry, and store. This ultra-strong, aluminum ramp provides the safety and strength required, while remaining light enough to go wherever you go.
feature_bullets: PORTABLE FOLDING RAMP: This ultra-strong, lightweight & portable ramp can be used as one unit or easily separated into 2 lightweight sections, making it even more convenient to use, carry & store.

SAFE & EASY: This portable ramp features an applied, slip-resistant surface & ergonomic, non-breakable carrying handles. Folded size: 72" x 15" x 4.5". Weight: 15 lbs. per section (2). Capacity: 800 lbs.
EASY & SAFE SETUP: Designed for high traffic use with curbs & 1-3 steps, this ramp can easily convert a mobility device to any terrain with 2 independently self-adjusting bottom transition plates.
INCREASE MOBILITY & SECURITY: Mobility solutions help you or a loved one regain confidence, freedom, & the ability to safely & independently access home or vehicle with less stress & more security.
ACCESS ANYWHERE: Our products offer an array of temporary, portable & permanent mobility solutions from toilet lifts to ramps to homecare products to walker, scooter, wheelchair & crutch accessories.
